page.title: 15TOURISM
page.content: HYTHE MARINA VILLAGE is a 50-acre development on the western side of Southampton water and is north of the Solent and the Isle of Wight. The idea for the village was derived from the best design elements in Venice. It has been researched in residential marina developments all over the world. The idea is to build stylish luxury homes, each one having a private berth adjacent to it. The berths range from 10 to over 25 metres, and additional berths are available for rental. The tidal range in the marina will be kept at a Mediterranean level by an entrance lock. In the extensive 'free flow' period the lock gates are permanently open. A resident lock keeper controls the gates. The marina will be made up of 225 individual architect designed houses and there will be restaurants bars and shops.
